preqs: Students must have completed MKF5926 or MKF5917, OR be enrolled in course 4431 to undertake this unit.

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {4431, B6010} Do Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {MKF5917, MKF5926} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {4431, B6010} Do Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {MKF5926, MKX9261} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true

time: First semester 2017 (On-campus split block of classes)

description: The aim of this unit is to extend knowledge and understanding beyond that covered in introductory marketing communication theory, and to develop improved skills to apply this understanding to practical and challenging communication scenarios. In particular emphasis will be placed on critical analysis and insights gained from exposure to the literature and professional practice in marketing communication.
